intro: Chamaerhododendros, commonly known as the mountain laurel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of shrubs that are native to the eastern United States and parts of Canada. The plants are characterized by their evergreen foliage and showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They thrive in acidic, well-drained soils and are often found in rocky or wooded areas. Chamaerhododendros species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
